speaker: Ronee
text: [_singing_] Good morning, good morning, I'd like a bagel too, and schmear it, with cream cheese, thank you... _Martin sways appreciatively, but Frasier comes out in his bathrobe, bleary and irritable._

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me, excuse me!  Did it occur to you that some of us might still be trying to sleep?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, lighten up, Fras, Ronee was just showing me how she can change the lyrics to any song to suit the occasion.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, very impressive.  Does she take requests?

speaker: Martin
text: Sure!

speaker: Frasier
text: Stop it!

speaker: Ronee
text: You know what you need, Grumpy?  A nice hot breakfast.  Marty, why don't you get Grumpy here some breakfast?

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't want any breakfast, and please stop calling me that.  [_To the tune of John Denver's "Thank God he's a country boy."_]

speaker: Ronee
text: [_singing_] Got me some ham, and some cakes on the griddle/ Whoo!  Good God, he's a grumpy boy!

speaker: Martin
text: You see what she just did?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it's mind-boggling.  Listen, Dad, do you mind giving me a ride to work today?  My car is in the shop.

speaker: Martin
text: Again?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, yeah, my seat-warmer's stuck on high, so I tried to offset it by blasting the air conditioner, which resulted in sort of a fog bank on my dashboard.

speaker: Ronee
text: I can give you a ride, Fras.  I mean, it's just an old Caddy, so there's nothing fancy like butt warmers or seat belts.

speaker: Frasier
text: Fine.  Let me just make sure my will is in order, and I'll be back in a minute.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I'm going to go take a shower.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_on his way out_] Don't use all the hot water!

speaker: Martin
text: I know.  Gotta leave enough for milady's tub.

speaker: Ronee
text: Oh, that's okay, I can take a shower too.

speaker: Martin
text: I wasn't talking about you. _Martin exits.  Ronee's mobile rings, she answers.  As she talks, Frasier re-appears in the hallway, but she doesn't see him._

speaker: Ronee
text: Hello?  Oh, Richard, hi. _Hearing this, Frasier ducks behind the wall.  As she turns toward the piano, he hunches closer to hear better._

speaker: Ronee
text: Listen, this really isn't a good time.  I was just heading into a yoga class and... yeah.  No, I would love to have dinner.  That sounds fun.  Okay, I'll see you then, sweetie. _As she hangs up, Frasier retreats a step, then makes a loud entrance, as if he just came in._

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I got two steps in my room and realized I'd forgotten - ah, there it is. [_To the tune of "There She Is, Miss America"_]

speaker: Ronee
text: [_singing_] There it is, Frasier's coffee cup...

speaker: Frasier
text: You are a national treasure. _FADE OUT  Scene Two - Caf e Nervosa Niles is seated at a table, composing a letter.  Frasier comes in. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!  Thank God you're here.  Listen, there's something I need to discuss with you.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, wait, wait, wait.  I'm in the middle of composing a plea to Alfred Antin in the meter of Dr. Seuss.

speaker: Frasier
text: Who?

speaker: Niles
text: Theodore Geisel, the children's author.  You know, "I do not like green eggs and ham/ I do not like them, Sam-I-Am..."

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, I know who Dr. Seuss is, you ninny.  Who's the other guy?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh-oh, Alfred Antin.  He's Seattle's premier scenic painter specializing in children's rooms.  His billowing clouds can be seen scudding across the ceilings of the finest nurseries in town, but he's booked solid.  So I thought if I wrote this...

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you've lost interest, haven't you?

speaker: Frasier
text: I was feigning interest to begin with.  Niles, I-I need your advice on something.  Uh, this morning, I-I heard Ronee on the phone make a date with another man.

speaker: Niles
text: Are you sure?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm positive.  She was talking to a man, yes, and in honeyed tones.

speaker: Niles
text: Mm...

speaker: Frasier
text: Here's my predicament.  I-I don't want to meddle, but I also don't want to see Dad get hurt.  So, how do you suggest we tell him?

speaker: Niles
text: [_looks up, surprised_] "We?"

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, "we."

speaker: Niles
text: Don't drag me into this, I don't know a thing about it.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know as much as I do, I just briefed you.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I didn't want to be briefed.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, then you should have said something, now you're in as deep as I am!  You can't unscramble an egg, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: What are you talking about?!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, boys, boys, boys, I'm glad I caught you.  Did you see this?

speaker: Niles
text: [_reading_] "Doo-wop-alooza"?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, one night only.  All the greats of doo-wop: The Coasters, The Platters, and that guy from The Teenagers is back from his hip replacement.

speaker: Niles
text: Wow...

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes...

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I know you guys aren't interested in modern music, but Ronee would really love it.  I was hoping maybe you could use your connections to maybe score us a couple of seats?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm afraid I'm not very well-connected in the doo-wop world, Dad.  Uh, if there's ever a "Mahler-palooza," I'm your man.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, I'll ask around. [_gathers his letter_] I have to go.  I'm off to try and win the heart and mind of A. Antin.  I'll go and meet him with my Daphne/ and hope that things don't go ker-phaphne!

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Fras, sorry again about this morning, you know, me and Ronee waking you up.  We were just having a little fun.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's all right.  It's great to have a fling once in a while, isn't it?

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, let me tell you something.  You don't go to Doo-wop- alooza with a "fling."

speaker: Frasier
text: I see.

speaker: Martin
text: You got something you want to say, son?

speaker: Frasier
text: No.

speaker: Martin
text: Fine. [_signals the waiter_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, all right, if you insist on dragging it out of me. Something happened this morning, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I was, uh, walking down the hall to retrieve my coffee, and, uh, Ronee was on the phone, and I didn't want to interrupt, so I waited, and I heard her make a... a date with another man.

speaker: Martin
text: So you eavesdropped, huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: No.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, a person's having a private conversation.  You stop and listen - that's eavesdropping!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, it was completely by accident.  I understand why you'd be upset, but please don't shoot the messenger.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, the messenger's got it coming if he's a dirty little eavesdropper! You walk into a private conversation, you make your presence known by some subtle way.  You can-can clear your throat- [_clears throat_] you can make a noise- [_hits the table_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, please!

speaker: Martin
text: [_gets up_] You know, just because people call in for your precious pearls of wisdom on the radio, it doesn't give you a free pass to get into everybody's business!  Now I know why you're always saying, "I'm listening" - because you always are!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, I'm glad the two of you found that so amusing, but as you just heard, it is rude to listen in on other people's conversations. _The men look at him blankly.  One of them gestures a question in sign language, while the other signs back and mouths, "I have no idea." Both men are deaf.  Chagrined, Frasier exits.  FADE TO:_ **THE FIRST OF SHEILA** _Scene Three - Apartment The doorbell rings.  Frasier answers the door to Niles, then returns to searching the couch cushions._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, come on in.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Frasier.  Hi, I'm just here to drop off these Doo-wop- alooza tickets for Dad.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh well, that was good luck, how did you manage it?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, actually, Alfred Antin and his wife are big doo-wop fans, and the couple that was going with them canceled, so-so they let... _He trails off, as Frasier repeatedly lifts the couch cushions, looking for something.  Niles lifts one himself._

speaker: Niles
text: They let me have the tickets.  What are we looking for?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, my money clip.  Have you seen it?

speaker: Niles
text: Rarely.

speaker: Frasier
text: I've misplaced it, [_kicks Martin's chair in frustration_] and it's distracting me no end.

speaker: Niles
text: Anyway, Dad was thrilled when I told him I found the tickets.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh well, I'm glad to hear that.  He was just a bit vexed when he left me earlier this morning.

speaker: Niles
text: Over what...? [_gasps_] Frasier, you told him about Ronee's date!

speaker: Frasier
text: As we agreed!

speaker: Niles
text: "We"?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, "we."

speaker: Niles
text: There's no "we!"  There's never been a "we!"

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, give it up, Niles!  There's blood on both our hands! [_checks his watch_] Oh, gosh, I better go eat something.  I've got my reading in twenty minutes.

speaker: Niles
text: Reading?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, I'm, uh, reciting "Annabelle Lee" for the Poe Society this evening.  I-I don't mind telling you, I'm just a bit nervous.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, don't worry - po' folk don't �spect much.

speaker: Niles
text: I had to say that.  Well, I'm off.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes. _Niles leaves.  Frasier removes a Chinese takeout carton and opens it for inspection, then staggers at the smell.  He closes it and replaces it in the refrigerator.  At a loss, he takes an apple from the basket and bites into it.  In the living room, Martin and Ronee enter through the front door._

speaker: Martin
text: It's this amazing doo-wop show... _Hearing them, Frasier wants to make his presence known, but his mouth is full of apple.  Rather than appear in that condition, he hides behind the kitchen entrance._

speaker: Martin
text: ...all the greats, one night only this Sunday.

speaker: Ronee
text: Sunday?  I'm sorry, I-I, I made plans.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, plans, huh?  Uh... what kind of plans? _Frasier swallows, but cannot now come out - he's already heard too much for his presence to seem innocent._

speaker: Ronee
text: Look, Marty, I like you too much to lie to you.  I, I have a date.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, oh, it's no problem, yeah.  Uh, want a drink?

speaker: Ronee
text: Oh no, I better not, I'm working.  Just a beer. _Frasier hides behind the range as Martin and Ronee comes in.  Martin gets two beers from the fridge and gives one to her._

speaker: Ronee
text: You're not upset, are you?  I mean, you know, we never really talked about not seeing other people.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh no, it's fine, no, no!  I'm seeing other people too.

speaker: Martin
text: Maybe I'll ask, uh... Sheila!  Yeah, she'll be all over this one.  So, uh, how about another night?

speaker: Ronee
text: Yeah, sure.  Um, what about Tuesday?

speaker: Martin
text: Great!

speaker: Ronee
text: Great. [_then_] Wow, I had no idea it was this late.

speaker: Ronee
text: [_o.s._] So, I'll call you about Tuesday. _Frasier rises, and exhales in relief - then ducks as Ronee comes back in.  But she has already noticed him.  Martin follows her back in._

speaker: Ronee
text: Frasier, what are you doing?

speaker: Frasier
text: I didn't know you two were home.  Uh, I was just cleaning the oven, I must have dozed off.

speaker: Ronee
text: Cool.  Well, I gotta run.  Goodnight, you two.

speaker: Martin
text: See ya.

speaker: Martin
text: You have a disease!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, please, I'm sorry, I'm sorry, let me explain-

speaker: Martin
text: No, there's nothing to explain!  I told you not to eavesdrop and you did it again, you are a very sick person!

speaker: Frasier
text: I tried to announce myself, I had a mouthful of apple rendering me speechless!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I was a cop, you think I haven't heard that one before?

speaker: Frasier
text: You are just angry because I heard you lying to Ronee.  You really expect to win Ronee's heart by inventing fictitious girlfriends?  "Sheila," indeed!

speaker: Martin
text: [_floundering_] It's none of your business, and... you weren't supposed to hear it!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I did hear it.

speaker: Martin
text: No, you _overheard_ it.  It's like an illegal wiretap - it's inadmissible!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, you cannot build a relationship on lies!

speaker: Martin
text: Inadmissible!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad!

speaker: Martin
text: IN-ADMISSIBLE!

speaker: Frasier
text: Fine! _There is the sound of two doors slamming, Martin's and then Frasier's. The powder room door opens - and Niles stiffly comes out, looking very embarrassed.  He exits the apartment.  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO  Scene Four - Caf e Nervosa Daphne and Niles are seated together at a table. _

speaker: Daphne
text: Why can't your father just go to the concert by himself?

speaker: Niles
text: Because Alfred Antin will be offended if we don't use his tickets, and then he won't paint our nursery. [_pleading_] Don't you want to be the one to go with him?

speaker: Daphne
text: Forget it, Niles.  We flipped a coin, and you were the doo- wop-a-loser.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Niles.  Ready to bob-bob-she-bob?

speaker: Niles
text: [_rises in horror_] Oh, dear God.  Is it a dance?  Am I going to have to move about?

speaker: Martin
text: No, you don't have to, but you're going to want to.

speaker: Niles
text: [_one last try_] Daphne?

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm pregnant.

speaker: Niles
text: What does that have to do with it?

speaker: Daphne
text: It's my blanket excuse until the baby is born.  After that, it'll be, "I can't leave the baby."  Get used to it. _Martin starts to exit, as Ronee enters with a man.  This is Richard. His hair is also white, but his greater height and lack of a cane are glaringly obvious - at least to Martin._

speaker: Ronee
text: Marty, hi.

speaker: Martin
text: Ronee, hey.

speaker: Ronee
text: Oh uh, this is Richard. [_introducing_] Martin, Daphne, Niles.

speaker: Richard
text: So how do you all know each other?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, uh...

speaker: Niles
text: Ronee was my baby-sitter.  I was a little monster.

speaker: Richard
text: [_to Martin_] And you?

speaker: Martin
text: Um...

speaker: Martin
text: Sheila!  Where have you been?

speaker: Martin
text: This is my date, Sheila. [_to Roz_] Got stuck at work, huh? [_he says gently nodding his head_]

speaker: Roz
text: Uh, yeah?

speaker: Martin
text: Sheila's a model.  She does all those big auto and RV shows. [_to Roz_] Point to something.

speaker: Ronee
text: Wow, impressive.  Nice meeting you. [_steers Richard to the counter_] Let's get ours to go.

speaker: Richard
text: Oh, but I thought...

speaker: Ronee
text: Roll with the punches, Dick.

speaker: Roz
text: What are you doing?

speaker: Martin
text: I'm trying to make her jealous.  Just go with it.

speaker: Roz
text: But I'm meeting my own date here.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, the concert starts in fifteen minutes, and Alfred Antin will be very angry if we're late.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I can't leave unless Sheila comes with me.

speaker: Roz
text: Hello?  Sheila has a date.

speaker: Niles
text: That's it. [_plucks the tickets out of Martin's pocket; to Daphne_] You and I are going.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_groans_] Oh, do we have to?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes. [_gets her up_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Do we really need clouds on the ceiling?  Couldn't we just push the crib closer to the ceiling?

speaker: Niles
text: Why even use a crib?  Let's put him in a pizza box! _They exit.  Martin notices Ronee looking their way, and laughs loudly, as though "Sheila" just made a joke._

speaker: Roz
text: Stop it!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, you - work with me here!

speaker: Roz
text: Okay, okay...

speaker: Larry
text: Roz?

speaker: Roz
text: [_breaks apart_] Larry, hi.  This is my dad.

speaker: Larry
text: Hello.  You brought your dad on our date?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, of course not.  He was just leaving, aren't you, Dad?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, but not until I finish my coffee.

speaker: Roz
text: [_looks_] You don't have any coffee.

speaker: Martin
text: Uh, get me one, would you, Larry?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, what are you doing here?  Hi, Roz. [_sees Larry_] Uh, hello.

speaker: Larry
text: Hi. [_to Roz_] Is your brother joining us too?

speaker: Roz
text: He's not my brother.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh now, that's no way to be. [_she gives him a scalding glare_] Still waiting on that coffee, Lar. _Larry turns to the counter.  Frasier, who, after eleven years has lost his ability to be surprised at setups like this, wearily pulls out a chair._

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay, what the hell's going on?

speaker: Martin
text: Nothing.

speaker: Ronee
text: Hi, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi, Ronee.

speaker: Ronee
text: See you, Marty, Sheila.

speaker: Martin
text: Take care, bye.

speaker: Frasier
text: So you've been pressed into service as Sheila, hmm?

speaker: Roz
text: [_feels her cheek_] Pressed is right - he nearly bit my lip off.

speaker: Larry
text: Here you go, Mr. Doyle.

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, thanks.

speaker: Roz
text: Come on, Larry, we're leaving.

speaker: Larry
text: It was nice meeting you, Mr. Doyle.  And you can owe me on that coffee - it was $3.75 and I flipped a quarter in the tip jar.

speaker: Roz
text: I'll be home early, Dad. _They leave, Roz grimacing as she now knows everything she needs to know before her date has begun._

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, when are you going to stop playing games and tell her how you feel?

speaker: Martin
text: It's too soon.  We've only been seeing each other a few weeks. I don't want to scare her off.

speaker: Frasier
text: How do you know you're going to scare her off?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, look at her, Fras.  She's young, she's got all these guys after her.  I'm lucky she even gave me a second glance. I don't want to blow it by looking like some desperate old guy with no options.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's not desperate to tell somebody how you feel about them.

speaker: Martin
text: What if she doesn't feel the same way?

speaker: Frasier
text: What if she does and you never find out?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad... just give her a call and tell her you want to talk to her.

speaker: Frasier
text: Was that a "leave me alone" grunt, or a "you've bested me again, son, with your unassailable logic" grunt?

speaker: Frasier
text: I thought so. _He folds his arms with a self-satisfied look.  FADE TO:  Scene Five - Apartment It's late at night, and Martin is watching TV.  Frasier enters._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hey, Dad.  What are you watching?

speaker: Martin
text: Sports wrap-up.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sports wrap-up?  Oh, that sounds like fun.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_watching_] Oof! [_chuckles_] Oh, gosh, that's not very sportsmanlike.

speaker: Martin
text: [_realizing_] I called her, okay?  Not that it's any of your business.

speaker: Frasier
text: So?

speaker: Martin
text: [_turns off the TV_] I left a message.  I'm glad she wasn't there, I don't know what I'll say if she calls back.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you did the right thing, Dad.  I am proud of you.

speaker: Martin
text: I don't know.  The whole thing's making me nervous.  You know, I know why she's not calling me back.  She just doesn't know how to tell me she's dropping me for Richard.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, who said anything about dropping you?

speaker: Martin
text: No one, apparently, or you would have overheard it. _Frasier makes a little "well, right" gesture, then opens the door to Ronee._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh hi, Ronee.

speaker: Ronee
text: Hi, Frasier.

speaker: Martin
text: Ronee, I didn't expect to see you tonight.

speaker: Ronee
text: Well, I got your message, and I was in the neighborhood.  So, what's up?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, uh... I was just heading out.

speaker: Ronee
text: What, at this hour?  I never thought you were such a night owl.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yeah.  Yeah, I love clubbin'.

speaker: Martin
text: I-I thought you'd just call.

speaker: Ronee
text: Well, you know, I was going to, but it sounded like maybe we needed to talk face-to-face.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah.

speaker: Ronee
text: Marty, is this about that woman I saw you with tonight?

speaker: Martin
text: Well... kind of.

speaker: Ronee
text: Yeah, I thought so. _Another pause - when we can see, though Martin cannot, that Ronee is afraid she's about to be dumped._

speaker: Ronee
text: Look, whatever it is, why don't you just come out and say it?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, all right.  Well, um... I'm not the kind of guy who... hey, you want a beer?

speaker: Ronee
text: Oh boy, do I need one?

speaker: Martin
text: [_heading to the kitchen_] No, I think we could both use one.

speaker: Martin
text: [_from the kitchen_] Oh, would you get that?  Frasier probably forgot his key.

speaker: Ronee
text: Yeah, sure.

speaker: Ronee
text: Oh, Sheila.  I kind of thought your date was over.

speaker: Roz
text: Well... maybe it is... [_sultry_] maybe it isn't.

speaker: Ronee
text: Gotcha.  Uh, just tell Marty: message received.

speaker: Roz
text: [_not getting it_] Okay.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey Roz, what are you doing here?

speaker: Roz
text: I found Frasier's money clip. [_holds it up_] Is he home?

speaker: Martin
text: No, uh-huh. [_looks around_] Where's Ronee?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, don't worry. [_"points" to the door_] "Sheila" showed Ronee the door.

speaker: Martin
text: What?! [_rushes to the door_] What the hell did you do that for?!

speaker: Roz
text: [_after him_] Hey, I have no control over what Sheila does. _FADE TO:  Scene Six - Parking Garage Frasier is walking toward his car in the garage, talking on his mobile._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh good, Niles, you're back.  How was the concert?  Well, you're the one who wanted that cloud mural.  I'm sure Pope Julius had to jump through similar hoops to get Michelangelo to paint his ceiling.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dear God, I think I've just realized where I must have dropped my money clip - Ronee's car.  She gave me a ride in it the day I lost it. [_looks closer_] Well, that's irresponsible of her. She's left it open. _He opens the passenger door to look inside.  A man approaches - the owner of the car parked next to Ronee's._

speaker: Man
text: Excuse me?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yes, of course. _Frasier gets into Ronee's car and closes the door to allow the other man into his car._

speaker: Frasier
text: There we are.

speaker: Man
text: Thank you. _As the man drives off, Frasier stays in Ronee's car, looking on the floor and continuing to talk into his phone._

speaker: Frasier
text: Anyway, I thought I'd swing by and take us both out for a nightcap.  All right, great.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, by the way, Niles, I spoke with Dad, and he has taken our advice about talking things over with Ronee.  Mine and yours, that's what I mean by "our!"  Oh, take some responsibility for once in your life, man! _Outside, Ronee is stalking to her car, as Martin runs after her. Hearing them coming, Frasier panics, trapped again._

speaker: Ronee
text: You could have at least warned me that Sheila was on her way up!

speaker: Martin
text: Ronee, it's all a misunderstanding-

speaker: Ronee
text: Marty, I really don't want to hear it!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you're going to hear it, because I'm not leaving!

speaker: Martin
text: Fine, just get in the car if you want to. [_opens the passenger door and gets in beside her_] We're just going to sit right here until you hear it all. _As they get in and shut the doors, Frasier has no choice but to huddle on the floor._

speaker: Ronee
text: Okay, go ahead.  But you better make it good, because I have a finely tuned crap-ometer.

speaker: Martin
text: There is no Sheila.  Her name's Roz.  She's Frasier's secretary.  I just pretended we were together.

speaker: Ronee
text: Forget it, Marty.

speaker: Martin
text: No, I know how this sounds, but it's true.

speaker: Ronee
text: Why would you do that?

speaker: Martin
text: Because I had gotten these concert tickets to impress you, and then when you said you had a date, I got... well, I got jealous so I said I was getting a date too, and then there you were in Nervosa, and when Roz came in, I made her Sheila. [_pause_] Do you believe me?

speaker: Ronee
text: You know, it's actually a little hot.

speaker: Martin
text: [_grinning_] Really? [_then_] Look, Ronee, uh, maybe I'm old- fashioned, but I know when something feels right.  I don't want to see anybody else.  I want to be exclusive, go steady, whatever they call it now.  Well, that's my story.  What about you?

speaker: Ronee
text: [_sighs_] Well... God, it's freezing in here!  I had a blanket. _Frasier's eyes widen in horror again.  As she reaches blindly into the backseat, he hurriedly gropes around for the blanket, and passes it into her hand._ [_N.B. See[[2.17]](/frasier/transcripts/season_2/episode_17/daphnes_room.html "Daphne's Room"), "Daphne's Room" for a similar predicament._]

speaker: Ronee
text: Okay.  Since we're being honest, well, I-I've done my share of dating, and I haven't always made the best choices.  I've dated the bad guys, the guys who can't commit, the guys who won't grow up, the creeps with the nice suit, the pathological liars...

speaker: Martin
text: Okay, I got it.

speaker: Ronee
text: Anyway, and then I started dating this really good guy - you.

speaker: Ronee
text: And I guess I-I just wanted to keep my options open with Richard because I wasn't sure how you felt about me.  But now I am. _They lean into each other and kiss.  Frasier dares to stick his head up, but they do not notice him._

speaker: Ronee
text: Now would be the time to put your class ring on a chain around my neck.

speaker: Martin
text: [_playfully_] Well, I got one upstairs.  Want to come get it? _They get out of the car.  Frasier sighs in relief and sits up in the backseat, starting to work out how to get out..._

speaker: Ronee
text: Wait, wait... _Frasier freezes as Martin and Ronee talk to each other over the hood of the car._

speaker: Ronee
text: I've got a better idea.  I know this secluded beach that's miles away from anything.  You want to go there and steam up the windows?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah. _Frasier has no choice but to duck down again.  As they get back in and Ronee starts the car, he buries his face as deep as possible.  END OF ACT TWO_
